abstract: In Silicon Valley, buying rather than building from the bottom up is seen as counter to the reinvention culture.
snippet: In Silicon Valley, buying rather than building from the bottom up is seen as counter to the reinvention culture.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  In moving to buy Yahoo, Microsoft may be firing the final shot of yesterday’s war.

headline.main: Yahoo Deal Is Big, but Is It the Next Big Thing?
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Deal Is Big, but Is It the Next Big Thing?

abstract: You can be sure that Microsoft will use the antitrust arguments it made against Google’s recent deal for Doubleclick again to claim that it simply had no choice but to shell out $44.6 billion for Yahoo.
snippet: You can be sure that Microsoft will use the antitrust arguments it made against Google’s recent deal for Doubleclick again to claim that it simply had no choice but to shell out $44.6 billion for Yahoo.

headline.main: Microsoft’s Inner Thoughts on Online Advertising

abstract: Google has raised antitrust questions about Microsoft’s proposed acquisition of Yahoo. Google has long feared Microsoft, but that deal could well be a boon because it would further slow down its already poky rivals.
snippet: Google has raised antitrust questions about Microsoft’s proposed acquisition of Yahoo. Google has long feared Microsoft, but that deal could well be a boon because it would further slow down its already poky rivals.
lead_paragraph: Google just released a statement on Microsoft’s bid to acquire Yahoo. David Drummond, Google’s general counsel, wrote that the prospective deal “raises troubling questions.” He goes on to outline the points in what may turn into an antitrust challenge were the deal to be consummated.
